questions.solution:

questions.nameText: In a triangle ABC,sin⁡A-cos⁡B=cos⁡C , then angle B is
questions.solution:

2B=π

questions.nameText:
In a ∆ABC, 

sin⁡A+sin⁡B+sin⁡C=1+2 

and, cos⁡A+cos⁡B+cos⁡C=2 

if, the triangle is
questions.solution:
If the triangle is equilateral

sin⁡A+sin⁡B+sin⁡C=332

If the triangle is isosceles, let

A=30°,B=30°,C=120°

Then, sin⁡A+sin⁡B+sin⁡C=1+32

If the triangle is right angled, let A=90°,B=30°,C=60°

Then,

sin⁡A+sin⁡B+sin⁡C=3+32

If the triangle is right angled isosceles, then one of the angles is 90° and the remaining two are 45° each, so that

sin⁡A+sin⁡B+sin⁡C=1+2

and,cos⁡A+cos⁡B+cos⁡C=2

questions.name: The general solution of the equation tan⁡3x=tan⁡5x is
questions.nameText: The general solution of the equation tan⁡3x=tan⁡5x  is
questions.solution:
We have,

tan⁡3 x=tan⁡5 x

⇒5x=n π+3x,n∈Z

⇒x=n π2,n∈Z

If n is odd, then x=n π2 gives extraneous solutions

Thus, the solution of the given equation will be given by x=n π2, where n is even, say n=2m,m∈Z

Hence, the required solution is x=m π,m∈Z

⇒tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ1-tan⁡θtan⁡4 θ=tan⁡(-7 θ)

⇒tan⁡5 θ=tan⁡(-7 θ)

⇒5 θ=n π+-7 θ,n∈Z⇒θ=n π12,n∈Z

questions.nameText: If A+B+C=0 , then the value of ∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B  is equal to

=cot⁡2Acot⁡2B+cot⁡2Bcot⁡2C+cot⁡2Ccot⁡2A

Now,

⇒tan⁡2A+2B+2C=0

⇒tan⁡2A+tan⁡2B+tan⁡2C=tan⁡2Atan⁡2Btan⁡2C

⇒cot⁡2Acot⁡2B+cot⁡2Bcot⁡2C+cot⁡2Ccot⁡2A=1

⇒∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B=1

questions.name: If ‘+’ means ‘-’, ‘-’ means ‘×’, ‘×’ means ‘÷’, and ‘÷’ means ‘+’, then what is the value of 40 ÷ 360 × 24 – 4 + 18 = ?
questions.nameText: If ‘+’ means ‘-’, ‘-’ means ‘×’, ‘×’ means ‘÷’, and ‘÷’ means ‘+’, then what is the value of 40 ÷ 360 × 24 – 4 + 18 = ?
questions.solution:
The given expression is 40 ÷ 360 × 24 – 4 + 18

Using the symbols correctly as given in the above question, the above expression becomes

40 + 360 ÷ 24 × 4 – 18

Using BODMAS RULE, we get

40 + 15 × 4 – 18 = 40 + 60 – 18

= 100 – 18 = 82

Therefore, the value of the given expression = 82.

questions.name: A total of 324 coins of 20 paise and 25 paise make a sum of Rs. 71. The number of 25 paise coins is
questions.nameText: A total of 324 coins of 20 paise and 25 paise make a sum of Rs. 71. The number of 25 paise coins is
questions.solution:
Let the number of 20 paise coins = x

Then, the number of 25 paise coins = (324-x) ).

According to the question, 20x+25324-x=7100 [Convert rupees into paise]

or, 20x+8100-25x=7100 [∵ 1 Rupee = 100 paise]

or 5x=1000 or, x=200

Therefore, required number of 25 paise coins = (324-x)

= (324 – 200)

= 200.

questions.name: If 18th February, 2005 falls on Friday then what will be the day on 18th February, 2007?
questions.nameText: If 18th February, 2005 falls on Friday then what will be the day on 18th February, 2007?
questions.solution:
According to the question

18th February, 2005 = Friday.

So, 18th February, 2006 = Friday + 1 day = Saturday.

So, 18th February, 2007 = Saturday + 1 day = Sunday. [∵ 2005, 2006 and 2007 are ordinary years]

Another method:

∵ 18th February, 2005 = Friday.

So, number of odd days from 19th February, 2005 to 18th February, 2007 = 730 = 7307 = 2 odd days. [∵ 2005, 2006 and 2007 are ordinary years.]

So, 1 year = 365 days and 2 years = 730 days]

Therefore, 18th February, 2007 = Friday + 2 days = Sunday.

questions.name: What is the angle between the minute hand and hour hand of a clock at 9 hours 45 minutes?
questions.nameText: What is the angle between the minute hand and hour hand of a clock at 9 hours 45 minutes?
questions.solution:
From the formula, θ = 30 h – 112 m ∵30h>112m

where θ = angle, m = minutes, h = hours

According to the question,

Here, m = 45 minutes, h = 9 hours.

So, θ = 30 × 9 - 112×45=270-4952

=540-4952=452=221°2

So, the angle between the two hands of a clock at 9 hours 45 minutes =221°2

questions.name: Vikash is facing towards west and turns through 45° clockwise, again 180° clockwise and then turns through 270° anticlockwise. In which direction is he facing now?
questions.nameText: Vikash is facing towards west and turns through 45° clockwise, again 180° clockwise and then turns through 270° anticlockwise. In which direction is he facing now?
questions.solution:
From the Fig. it is clear that Vikash initially faces in the direction OP. Then on moving 45° clockwise, Vikash faces in the direction OQ. On further moving 180° clockwise, he faces in the direction OR.

Then, Vikash finally faces in the direction OS after moving 270° anticlockwise.

From the basic direction diagram, it is clear that direction OS is South-west.

Therefore, Vikash is now facing South-west.

Shortcut method:

Clockwise directions: 45° + 180° = 225°

Anticlockwise direction: 270°

questions.name: Deepak said to Prakash, “That boy playing football is the younger of the two brothers of the daughter of my father’s wife.” How is the boy playing football related to Deepak?
questions.nameText: Deepak said to Prakash, “That boy playing football is the younger of the two brothers of the daughter of my father’s wife.” How is the boy playing football related to Deepak?
questions.solution:
Father’s wife ⇒ Mother

Mother’s Daughter ⇒ Sister

Deepak’s sister’s younger brother ⇒ Deepak’s younger brother.

Therefore, the ‘boy’ is the brother of ‘Deepak’.

questions.name: If ''P $ Q'' means ''P is father of Q''; ''P # Q'' means ''P is mother of Q''; ''P * Q'' means ''P is sister of Q'', then how is D related to N in N # A $ B * D?
questions.nameText: If ''P $ Q'' means ''P is father of Q''; ''P # Q'' means ''P is mother of Q''; ''P * Q'' means ''P is sister of Q'', then how is D related to N in N # A $ B * D?
questions.solution:
N # A ⇒ N is mother of A.

A $ B ⇒ A is father of B.

B * D ⇒ B is sister of D.

So, D ⇒ son or daughter of A.

N ⇒ mother of A.

Therefore, D is the grandson or granddaughter of ''N'' i.e. Data is inadequate.

options.name: All I, II and III follow

questions.solution:
Conclusion I:

''Some mirrors are chairs'' + ‘All chairs are glasses'' i.e. I + A ⇒ I i.e. ''Some mirrors are glasses'' →Conversion ''Some glasses are mirrors'' i.e. I-type

Therefore, conclusion I follows.

Conclusion II:

''All tables are mirrors + ''Some mirrors are chairs'' i.e. A + I ⇒ No conclusion.

Therefore, conclusion II does not follow.

Conclusion III:

''All tables are mirrors i.e. A →Conversion ''Some mirrors are tables'' i.e. I-type

Therefore, conclusion III follows.

Another way:

questions.nameText: A man earns x% on the first Rs. 2000 and y% on the rest of his income. If he earns Rs. 700 from Rs. 4000 and Rs. 900 from Rs. 5000 of income, find x% %.
questions.solution:
2000×x100+2000×y100=700 ...(.i))

and 2000×x100+3000×y100=900 ...(.ii))

On simplifying these equations change to x+y=35 and 2x+3y=90 . Solving these two equations simultaneously, we get x=15% %.

questions.solution:

Their order of arrival is Anil and Anita, Raj and joya, Raman and Shanthi, Sunil and Sridevi.

questions.name: In a certain school, the number of students in each section was 24. After admitting some students, three new sections have been started and now there are 16 sections with 21 students in each. What is the number of newly admitted students?
questions.nameText: In a certain school, the number of students in each section was 24. After admitting some students, three new sections have been started and now there are 16 sections with 21 students in each. What is the number of newly admitted students?
questions.solution:
Total number of students when there were 24 students in each of 13 sections =13 × 24 = 312

Total number of students when three new section were added with 21 students in each of 16 sections

= 21 × 16 = 336

Number of newly admitted students = 336 - 312 = 24
